TopicTitle: Assign engines as reaction control systems (RCS)

Articles.Content:
Sometimes RCS just isn't enough.

I think it would be great if we could assign rocket engines to respond in the same was as rcs thrusters to allow us to control our rockets with a little extra power.
Six-axis action groups is rather a lot to setup. Engines as RCS... very overkill, very Kerbal, probably useful for moving those heaver asteroids around.

Ion engines or ants, for large stations.

+1, would use.
Whackjob would like this. I saw one of his pictures with Aerospikes as RCS.

Six-axis action groups is rather a lot to setup.

Not really. Just hard to use. Because you can make it so it toggles that engine cluster or something, and then you throttle control it.

Add an 'RCS' group into the action groups page (along with staging, lights, brakes, 1-10 etc)

Than have engines added to this group be activated/deactivated/fired by the RCS schema

----------

Until such time however, I've been making some 'Grande' RCS thrusters for dealing with the expanded mass paradigm of the SLS parts because the 1 power stock ones just don't cut it

this is why i want analog action groups. make it so any of the 6 normal axes (plus additional ones you can map to your controls) to various actions. you could map axes to tweakables for example, or treat engines like rcs thrusters.
